contentrichtext.text: '''Upper Pohatcong Mountain''' is a ridge in the [[Appalachian Mountains]] of northwestern [[New Jersey]] in the [[United States]]. It is located in eastern [[Warren County, New Jersey|Warren County]], and extends northeast of [[Washington, New Jersey|Washington]] approximately 6 mi (10 km) to the vicinity of [[Hackettstown, New Jersey|Hackettstown]]. The ridge has an average height of approximately 800 ft (240 m) and reaches a maximum summit of 1235 ft (374 m). The ridge is the northeast continuation of [[Pohatcong Mountain]] south of Washington. The two ridges are sometimes called "Pohatcong Mountain" collectively. ==External links== * [http://www.americasroof.com/highest/nj.shtml New Jersey's highest named summits] {{coord|40.843714|-74.857559|type:mountain_globe:earth_region:US-NJ|display=title}} [[Category:Mountain ranges of New Jersey]] [[Category:Geography of Warren County, New Jersey]] {{NJ-geo-stub}}
